intro: Relbunium bermudense, commonly known as Bermuda buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Bermuda. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting to the harsh conditions of the island. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it produces small, hairy fruits that disperse its seeds by wind. Relbunium bermudense plays a role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects.
